p: The Henderson and Caurie equations all conferred a uniform distribution of residual plots. However, the quantitative criteria were not consistent. For example, for the adsorption data at 5 °C, 15 °C and 25 °C, the Caurie equation had larger values of R 2 and smaller value of s and PRESS. The Henderson equation, on the other hand, had a smaller value for MRE. Both equations could describe well the adsorption data for A. formosanus Hayata.
